    Docstrings
    LearnBase.AbstractBatchIterator
    LearnBase.AbstractBatchView — Type.
    abstract AbstractBatchView{TElem, TData} <: DataView{TElem, TData}

    Baseclass for all vector-like views of some data structure, that views it as some form or vector of equally sized batches.

    see MLDataPattern.BatchView for a concrete example.

    LearnBase.AbstractDataIterator
    LearnBase.AbstractObsIterator
    LearnBase.AbstractObsView — Type.
    abstract AbstractObsView{TElem, TData} <: DataView{TElem, TData}

    Baseclass for all vector-like views of some data structure, that views it as some form or vector of observations.

    see MLDataPattern.ObsView for a concrete example.

    LearnBase.AbstractSet
    LearnBase.BatchIterator — Type.
    abstract BatchIterator{TElem,TData} <: DataIterator{TElem,TData}

    Baseclass for all types that iterate over of some data source one batch at a time.

    @assert typeof(RandomBatches(X, size=10)) <: BatchIterator

for x in RandomBatches(X, size=10)
    @assert nobs(x) == 10
    # ...
end

    see MLDataPattern.RandomBatches

    LearnBase.Cost — Type.

    Baseclass for any kind of cost. Notable examples for costs are Loss and Penalty.

    LearnBase.DataIterator — Type.
    abstract DataIterator{TElem,TData}

    Baseclass for all types that iterate over a data source in some manner. The total number of observations may or may not be known or defined and in general there is no contract that getobs or nobs has to be supported by the type of data. Furthermore, length should be used to query how many elements the iterator can provide, while nobs may return the underlying true amount of observations available (if known).

    see MLDataPattern.RandomObs, MLDataPattern.RandomBatches

    LearnBase.DataView — Type.
    abstract DataView{TElem, TData} <: AbstractVector{TElem}

    Baseclass for all vector-like views of some data structure. This allow for example to see some design matrix as a vector of individual observation-vectors instead of one matrix.

    see MLDataPattern.ObsView and MLDataPattern.BatchView for examples.

    LearnBase.DiscreteSet — Type.

    Set of discrete items

    LearnBase.DistanceLoss — Type.

    A supervised loss that can be simplified to L(targets, outputs) = L(targets - outputs) is considered distance-based.

    LearnBase.IntervalSet — Type.

    A continuous range (inclusive) between a lo and a hi

    LearnBase.LearnBase
    LearnBase.Learnable
    LearnBase.Loss — Type.

    Baseclass for all losses. A loss is some (possibly simplified) function L(features, targets, outputs), where outputs are the result of some function f(features).

    LearnBase.MarginLoss — Type.

    A supervised loss, where the targets are in {-1, 1}, and which can be simplified to L(targets, outputs) = L(targets * outputs) is considered margin-based.

    LearnBase.Minimizable — Type.

    Baseclass for any prediction model that can be minimized. This means that an object of a subclass contains all the information needed to compute its own current loss.

    LearnBase.ObsDim — Module.
    module ObsDim

    Singleton types to define which dimension of some data structure (e.g. some Array) denotes the observations.

    • ObsDim.First()
    • ObsDim.Last()
    • ObsDim.Contant(dim)

    Used for efficient dispatching

    LearnBase.ObsDimension — Type.

    see ?ObsDim

    LearnBase.ObsIterator — Type.
    abstract ObsIterator{TElem,TData} <: DataIterator{TElem,TData}

    Baseclass for all types that iterate over some data source one observation at a time.

    using MLDataPattern
@assert typeof(RandomObs(X)) <: ObsIterator

for x in RandomObs(X)
    # ...
end

    see MLDataPattern.RandomObs

    LearnBase.Penalty
    LearnBase.StochasticTransformation
    LearnBase.SupervisedLoss — Type.

    A loss is considered supervised, if all the information needed to compute L(features, targets, outputs) are contained in targets and outputs, and thus allows for the simplification L(targets, outputs).

    LearnBase.Transformation — Type.

    Anything that takes an input and performs some kind of function to produce an output. For example a linear prediction function.

    LearnBase.TupleSet — Type.

    Groups several heterogenous sets. Used mainly for proper dispatch.

    LearnBase.UnsupervisedLoss — Type.

    A loss is considered unsupervised, if all the information needed to compute L(features, targets, outputs) are contained in features and outputs, and thus allows for the simplification L(features, outputs).

    LearnBase.addgrad!
    LearnBase.datasubset
    LearnBase.default_obsdim — Function.
    default_obsdim(data)

    The specify the default obsdim for a specific type of data. Defaults to ObsDim.Undefined()
